mcknighte.controller

Class ClientController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mcknighte.common.MessageController
      • mcknighte.common.AbstractController<Client,ClientFacade>
        • mcknighte.controller.ClientController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @Named(value="clientController")
 @SessionScoped
public class ClientController
extends AbstractController<Client,ClientFacade>
    ClientController, controller class to act as middle man between Client views and the business logic
    Since:
    2017
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Edward McKnight (UP608985)
    See Also:
    AbstractController, AppointmentController, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • clientExists

        public boolean clientExists(String userName,
                            boolean message,
                            String element)
        Check whether a client exists and output a Faces message if it does to the specified element
        Parameters:
        userName - the username of the client to check whether exists
        message - whether or not to display an error message if the client doesn't exist
        element - the UIComponent to display the error message on (if being used)
        Returns:
        whether or not the client exists

      • getCountries

        public List<String> getCountries()
        Get the list of countries from the business logic
        Returns:
        a list of ISO countries

      • doAddClient

        public String doAddClient(String password,
                          String passwordAgain)
        Process adding a client, checking that the new password has been correctly entered twice and that the username isn't already taken
        Parameters:
        password - the password for the new client
        passwordAgain - the repeated password for the new client
        Returns:
        the view displayed

      • doEditClient

        public String doEditClient(String currPassword,
                           String newPassword,
                           String passwordAgain)
        Processing editing a client, ensuring that the new password (if used) has been correctly entered twice
        Parameters:
        currPassword - the client's current password
        newPassword - the client's new password
        passwordAgain - the repeated client's new password
        Returns:
        the view displayed
